column4: I feel like an idiot for being unable to get this to work:  I have installed Ubuntu 8.10 on an external USB hard drive.  This is a large drive and I did a standard install, not a "usb bootable."
When I reboot, I get grub error 21.
I don't see any obvious-to-me errors in the menu.lst
can you pastebin it?
My menu.lst?
ya
Sure, it'll take a minute or two.  I need to reboot from a Live CD or something so I can see it.
http://pastebin.com/m477f0e80
what's the mobo?
MSI Wind PC, MS-6496
dual boot?
No.  When I am trying to boot, there is nothing attached but the USB drive, and it has only Ubuntu 8.10 on it.
do you know the drive name /dev/sd0 ?
I'm not sure what you're asking, sorry.
you answered it
Clearly I'm more communicative than I know!
no clue hopefully someone else knows a fix
Thanks, anyway.
all I'm seeing on the web is people saying "reinstall"
My related question was: If I make a bootable SD card (which I've done) is it easy to make sure that some particular external drive is always mounted at the same point?
Well, reinstalling a fresh install can't hurt.
you can use fstab and mtab to make sure things are mounted in the place you want them to be mounted at
Yup, I've found e2label, which looks like it will do the trick.  Thanks.
